utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: I want to reassure you, your child can have a completely normal life.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: How can a baby have male and female DNA?

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: It’s a condition called Genetic Mosaicism. The ambiguous genitalia can be surgically repaired.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Repaired?

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: Made to look more typical.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: More typical? But you haven’t even told us if the baby is a boy or a girl.

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: That’s — that’s a choice you have to make.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Good job Jackson.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Take it.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: He had the shot. He lost his nerve.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Honey it's OK, he’s doing great.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Three.

utterance.speaker: Melanie and Joseph
utterance.content: Whooo!

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: No fear that time.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Melanie!

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Oh my God! Jackson?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Black heels or the boots?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know I’m a fan of those heels.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Boots it is.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: For all we know, House knows you’re a fan of those heels.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Like House is going to find out we faked our breakup because of your shoes? Go with the boots.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You gonna eat that?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Have at it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Did you just ask my permission before you took my food?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yes we can.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Adolescent genetic mosaic collapsed during a basketball game, presenting with persistent pelvic pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fun!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The parents haven’t told their son that he could have been their daughter. They want assurance that you won’t either.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Less fun, but still.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That was easy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Our new patient, part girl, part boy, all Thirteen’s dream date.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Severe pelvic pain started during a basketball game, could be dehydration.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: ER gave him fluids when he came in.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Still, it feels chronic.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We got a kid who could mate with himself and we think he didn’t have enough to drink? There are dozens of intersex disorders, persistent pelvic pain could mean Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia, PMDS?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Those conditions occur in intersex kids who are chromosomally XX or XY, not XX and XY. Parents recently started him on testosterone, maybe there’s something —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Vitamins wouldn’t cause pelvic pain. There’s a note in here, we’re supposed to refer to his testosterone shots as vitamins. His parents aren’t just liars, they want us to be liars too.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I won’t do it. You guys will though.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He’s a kid. Parents don’t think he’s ready to deal with it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: My dad was the same way about me maybe having Huntingtons, it's —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well that was your experience. Must surely apply in this situation.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Pain could be caused by a blind uterus hidden in his abdomen. He needs an MRI.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Right, boy with girl genes; I’m sure you’re the first doctor brilliant enough to check for a uterus. He could have complications from the surgeries on his penis, that can cause pelvic pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Way to multitask, impress your boss and humiliate your ex. MRI’s a waste of time. To continue the humiliation, go put a camera up his penis.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: You're Dr. House, aren’t you? What do you think is wrong with our son?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: These people were just coming to tell you. This is better, don’t have to worry about them losing their way.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: We think that he has a blind uterus, he should have an MRI.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you send them a text?

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Over the past thirteen years, we’ve educated ourselves.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, who needs med school when you’ve got Wi-Fi? Go schedule their son for an MRI with contrast right away.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You just said an MRI was a waste of time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So’s arguing with them.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Contrast in.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Jackson, we’re going to get started so try to lie still.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How long do you think the post-breakup awkwardness is going to last?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Foreman and I are both professionals. Stomach and liver are clear.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If by professional you mean he’s a T1000 built by Cyberdine Systems? I never understood what you saw in him.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He’s not really your type huh? Moving down for the pelvic floor.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Here’s my impression of Foreman on the happiest day of his life. Now the saddest day of his life.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We just broke up. I’m not quite ready to mock him yet.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: House was a jerk to split you two up, but, bottom line, he did you a favor.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Area around the intestinal tract is clear. No blind uterus.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I think, there’s something wrong with House.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Who’s he making miserable now?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Actually, no one. He OK’d an MRI just because the parents wanted to look for a blind uterus. There was no fighting, no arguing, he just went along.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It’s a valid medical theory.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: He doesn’t think it is. House decided to humor these parents.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Maybe he had a great cup of coffee, or a tremendous bowel movement. Bottom line is your boss is in a good mood, stop analyzing it and just enjoy it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We’re going to use this scope to fill your bladder with saline, then examine your urethra for any narrow spots.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: Why would there be a narrow spot?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sometimes it just happens.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: Can my parents come in?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I thought it would be awkward for you, having them here.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: I have this feeling they’ve seen me naked before.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Now take a breath, just try to relax.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: Mom.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: It's okay honey. It's okay. Hey, remember those sprints they made you run in practice? Those were so hard, but you pulled through. You can do this too.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Up to the bladder, start the saline.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I’m going to look around and pull back on the scope.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: It feels tight.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That pressure’s normal, just try to hold on for a few more minutes.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: Its not down there, its my chest .

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: Can’t breath, can’t, can’t breath.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Is he okay?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Muffled heart sounds. Jugular’s distended.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pericardial effusion we need ten gauge and a syringe.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: What’s happening?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: His heart is filling with exudate, if we don’t drain it, it will stop beating.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We drained the fluid from his pericardial space; his heart rate is back to normal.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pelvis, plus heart, doesn’t fit with any of the syndromes associated with mosaicism.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Could be drugs, toxins, an infection?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You’re okay with this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: With what?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: That we’re considering a diagnosis unrelated to this kid being a shemale. Assuming a coincidence like that would usually torture you, but you’re completely unfazed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Completely unfazed? You think I’m totally lacking in any fazing? The idea that I’m anything less than half-fazed, I actually find offensive. It greatly fazes me.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He started testosterone —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Vitamins

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: A few months ago. That can cause autoimmune diseases like Polyarteritis and SLE, which can cause pericardial effusion and pelvic pain. So it is related.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now I’m unfazed. Start him on corticosteroids for the autoimmune and Finasteride to block the vitamins.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You slept with House.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He asked permission before taking my bagel, took the case without a fight, honored the parents’ request for an MRI.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yes, those were my terms for sleeping with him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He’s in a good mood.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Sex with me would explain that, but it doesn’t explain why I’m not curled up in a ball weeping in shame. I did not have sex with House.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you two aren’t keeping something from me that means he’s keeping something from both of us. That can’t be good.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Or he’s just in a good mood, this is not a crisis. Maybe you can get back some of that money he owes you?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Testosterone blocker? Does that mean if Jackson has SLE or whatever that other thing was that he’d have to go off the hormones?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Probably.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Then Jackson will stop developing, he’ll never go through puberty.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Maybe this isn’t what’s wrong with him. Maybe the testosterone didn’t cause it.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Yeh, but if it is, then he’ll never be a man. Did we make the wrong choice?

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: You’ll need to tell him the testosterone blocker is something else.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Or maybe this is a good opportunity to tell him the truth. It might make it simpler, for all of you.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: You want us to tell a sick adolescent boy that he’s really not an adolescent boy. That doesn’t seem simpler to me. No, just, give him the meds.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, you have pain in one arm and both your legs. Does it hurt right now?

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: No, its, when, I like put pressure on them. See, it hurts when I do this, Ow, and this, Ow, and this, Ow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How about this?

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Owwwwwwwwwwwwww!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Did you give House the moron with the broken finger?

utterance.speaker: Nurse Helen
utterance.content: They’ve been in room two about ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The patient should have been screaming for another doctor seven minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: Ian
utterance.content: Thanks brah.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: If I have this IV, why do I need a shot too?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Just some extra medicine, just to be safe. I hear you’re quite the basketball player, what position?

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: Point guard.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Small forward. How’s your crossover dribble?

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: It’s okay, I’m not really that into basketball.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You’re going to feel a little pinch, okay. So, if you’re not that into it, why’d you join the team?

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: My Mom kinda made me do it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: My parents were the same way, always pushing me to try new things.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: It was more like what she didn’t want me to try. I wanted to take dance, but she flipped out and made me choose between basketball and hockey.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What does your Dad say?

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: He seemed okay with it, then he just caved in to my Mom.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Your palm is red.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: What’s that mean?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That we still don’t know what’s wrong with you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You were right; he is in a good mood.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Bummer it didn’t work out with you and Thirteen.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It happens.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You guys seemed happy together. It’s probably for the best, you know, the bisexual thing and all.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It was never an issue.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: No, it never is, until it is. This is Thirteen. Before you guys got together she was hooking up with a different girl every night. Long term you really think you could compete with that?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, we have to talk.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Stop pretending to be asleep, we’re not leaving. House.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House, House.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He’s not breathing.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Can you get a pulse?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Barely.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Call a code.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Get an ambu bag from the nurses station.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Heart’s still working that means synapsis is still firing, we just need to get a message through.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Aaahh!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You stopped breathing.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What the hell is going on?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think my penis stopped breathing; do you know CPR?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Looks like your brain is Okay. Pupils are equal, round, and reactive.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m fine, other than the fact that my nurple is now purple. No wonder you broke up with him. I’m surprised yours are still attached.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: By the way, I can see that from here. I assume those are our patient’s lab results.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Patient can wait; you could have died.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The only reason you’d ignore a near death experience is you don’t care or you already know why it happened.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's called Vicodin, I took too many.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can I please get some information about our patient?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Patient’s palms are red; lab tests confirm liver and kidney dysfunction.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I don’t remember you taking any Vicodin today.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don’t remember hiring my Mother. What causes the enzymes in little Boy George’s existing heart problem and pelvic pain?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You didn’t take any yesterday at breakfast either.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don’t remember having breakfast with my Mother.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Amyloidosis with systemic involvement.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Protein levels are normal. This kid’s depressed, if he’s self-medicating with drugs and alcohol that would explain his symptoms.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Search the school; search the home.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Seriously, or are you just deflecting?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Both.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nowhere, I’m staying right here, so we can properly discuss this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He’s on Heroin.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How can you? —

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Number one, he’s happy, which means he’s high. Number two, when he moved his bad leg he didn’t use his hands to support it. Whatever he’s taking, it’s stronger than Vicodin.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What are we gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You really think House took too many Vicodin?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The guy pops’em like candy, I’m surprised it hasn’t happened before. You miss sleeping with women?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Simple question.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yes. It’s a simple answer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’ll check under the bed.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I also miss sleeping with other men and I’m sure you miss sleeping with other women. Monogamy is like saying your never going to have any other ice cream flavor besides rocky road.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So, your saying, if you don’t have pink bubble gum for a while that one day you’re going to chase down the ice cream truck?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No. Rocky Road is great. It’s a very delicious and complicated flavor. I also know that if I have other flavors, then rocky road is going to be left in the freezer where anyone can just, dip in. Can we please drop the metaphor? . Why is this coming up now?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Kutner said the silver lining of our breakup was, I wouldn’t be dumped for a girl. There’s nothing in here either, seems like we’re wrong about this kid having drug or alcohol —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: When did he bring that up?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Earlier today, right before —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: This morning Taub called you a robot.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Huh! Either it’s a big coincidence or, their jerking us around. They know.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And if they know, House knows. This is bad.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, this is good. House only has two ways to handle us going out, he jerks us around or he fires us. He chose option A; this is good.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: But this is bad.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: “I stand alone my soul and me, beneath the mask that others” “see.”

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: His chest is still rising. He’s just screwing with me cause Cuddy made me babysit.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: “A pain that tears and bites and will not bend, only when I sleep, will it end.”

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Downer, and medically irre…

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You sure his chest is moving?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: House?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If he’s faking you think he’s going to come clean because you said his name?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Back off. Only Thirteen gets to grab my nipples this time.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You know, recreating the moment when you made us crap our pants isn’t actually all that funny.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That is sweet that you’re worried about House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unless the next stanza reads, “Hoping to fry my brain to death, I smoked some primo crystal meth,” I’m not interested.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You can’t deny that this kid may be suicidal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We’re not here to make him happy; we’re here to diagnose him.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It’s an infection. Swab of the kid’s water bottle turned up Toxoplasmosis.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I’ll start him on Pyrimethamine.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: I had no idea he felt this way.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Is there a therapist here that you can recommend?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It might help more if you talk to him.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: He’s not ready.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: If telling him the truth would help him stop feeling like this.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: If I knew that it would make him less confused I’d tell him right now, but if she’s wrong we’d only make things worse.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He obviously senses he’s different. He’s looking for answers.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Every teenager feels different. He’s sick; this isn’t the time to spring this on him.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: When you give Jackson the antibiotics, will you please restart the testosterone?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I get House wanting to jerk me and Thirteen around, but you guys?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Told you they were still together.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How’d he know?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Noticed you smell like Thirteen’s soap every morning.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You figured it out?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Yes, I’m a little slow; maybe someone should let me know when I should be insuIted.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Then House doesn’t know.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: He probably does now that you felt her up during that last differential.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You noticed this, but House didn’t?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Yes, I get it; He’s generally smarter than me. Can we please move on?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He’s not generally smarter than you; he’s always smarter than you. Unless?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House is on Heroin.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, that’s certainly, an interesting notion.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s why his lungs stopped, its why he OK’d the MRI, its why he missed things he wouldn’t ordinarily miss.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Uh, we’ll runs some tests, and I’ll let you know.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He’s there isn’t he?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well that would certainly explain the inappropriate responses. I gotta go. Okay. sorry, consult.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When did you order these?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: When you were in the bathroom. I thought a celebration was in order. To cheating death.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You off bourbon? We can get you something else.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I came here expecting a burger. Figured I’d have to endure a little lecture on moderation.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You never listen. So why —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Instead, I get a drink; a nice little serving of respiratory depressant on the day that my lungs stop working.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You seem fine now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don’t believe that I OD’d on Vicodin. You figure I’m on something stronger, and because you can never, ever assume anything but the most screwed up scenario as far as I’m concerned —

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Funny how I’m usually right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think that I’m on Heroin. This is your version of a tox screen. Because if I am on Heroin; I can’t drink that without risking another bout of not breathing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Goodnight.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: Another shot?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm afraid so.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: That looks like the vitamins my parents give me, same red top.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: These aren't vitamins.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I can't tell you that. You should ask your parents.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You idiot!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, I admit it. I have bulimia. I look good though, don't I?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Heroin. Heroin! House, of all the stupid —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not on heroin.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I just caught you with your fingers down your throat.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm on methadone. Stupid product. Heroin without the high.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, and twice the risk of death.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But no risk of arrest.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You nearly died.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Today was a fluke. I nodded off.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Right, you're safe as long as you never sleep again. Mistime your dose, you die. Couple of drinks, you die. Mix it with the wrong drugs, you die. You want to detox from Vicodin? Pick something that won't kill you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not detoxing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: If you're looking for something to help with your pain —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Doesn't help my pain, it eliminates it. My leg doesn't hurt anymore.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: She completely disregarded our instructions.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He asked a question. I was tired of lying. I didn't tell him anything about his genetic condition.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: I want her removed from our son's case.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'm sorry for the position Dr. Hadley put you in, but I can't do that. She's a valuable part of Dr. House's diagnostic team. If he stays on the case, so does she.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: We have to deal with Jackson. These questions aren't gonna go away.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: He's not ready for this.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Let's hope you're wrong.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I'll stay away from their son.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No — you won't. In about 15 minutes, you're the only person that kid's gonna trust. If he needs a hand to hold, make sure yours is available.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: So what? Am I a boy or a girl?

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Some of your cells are male… and some are female.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: So basically I'm a freak.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: No, no, buddy. You're just a little different.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: You've known this...since I was born, and you never told me.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: We didn't want you to be confused.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: So you lied to me.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Oh, please, sweetie, we were just trying to protect you.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: Don't. Just leave me alone. Get out.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Let's go.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You still breathing in there? 'Cause if not, I'm sending in janitorial.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not breathing, but it's strictly voluntary. Should've seen the guy who was in here before me.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I know about the methadone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's legal. I have a prescription.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Whatever doctor you conned into writing it clearly had no idea about your addiction issues — Your lack of —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He knows I'm in pain. What I put in my body is my business.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You keep taking this, you could die.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you'd said that if I keep doing this you could die, then it'd be your business.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I can't sit by and watch you kill yourself. As long as you're in my hospital, you can't do methadone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll send someone for my stuff.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That's it, you're quitting? You're choosing methadone over this job?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm choosing lack of pain over this job.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Eventually you have to talk to your parents again.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: No, I don't. I have this one friend — on my basketball team, Will. We hang out a lot. I really like him. Now I'm worried that I...you know, “like” him. Maybe I'm supposed to. Because if I'm really a girl.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Do you feel like a girl?

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: I like dancing more than basketball. Is that what that means?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Jackson. As hard — as it is right now, at least it's out in the open.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: This was an English assignment. We were supposed to write a poem in the style of Sylvia Plath.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You don't feel this way?

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: I'm sad sometimes; I don't wanna die. At least, I didn't. Are these antibiotics supposed to make you nauseous?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah, they can.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're on our own.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Is he okay?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's fine. He's just not here.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Did he quit? Did she suspend him?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She didn't say. She just told me I was in charge until further notice. So if we add bloody vomit to our patient's list of symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Surgeon reports the bleeding was caused by a gastric fistula caused by Necrotizing Pancreatitis.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: She must've told you something.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nothing that would help us with this patient.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Heart, liver, kidneys, and pancreas. Obviously whatever this kid's got is something systemic.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Zollinger-Ellison?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or Systemic Scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Zollinger-Ellison fits better.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: Can we at least call House?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We can. I have. He's not answering. Put the patient on proton pump inhibitors. If he gets better, it's Zollinger-Ellison; If not, it's scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Zollinger-Ellison doesn't fit better. You don't want it to be scleroderma because that means he's gonna die.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Patients die all the time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not the ones whose family you've ruined. I don't think that, you do. It's not your fault.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He was no more confused than any other teenager. Then I started a fire and threw gas on it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You were trying to help.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hi, is House here?

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: He's getting dressed. I'll be back around 10:00 tonight. Go on in.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Who was she?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I hired her to watch me sleep — make sure I don't stop breathing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Home nurses usually wear scrubs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's not a nurse.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You hired a hooker to watch you sleep? That just can't

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Surprisingly, hookers are cheaper. And they don't sue for sexual harassment. Which one?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You, shaved.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The red one then.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You have two ties?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Meeting at St. Sebastian's today. Gonna try and talk 'em into starting up a diagnostics department.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sounds great. I just came by to check up on you. See how you were doing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I guess you are.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: He hasn't responded to the medication at all?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm afraid not.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: So, that means he's got the other thing?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm so sorry. We'll start him on anti-inflammatories. If we're lucky, that will slow down the progression.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: My son has a death sentence and I can't go in there and be with him because of you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: You find a homework assignment and decide he's suicidal; make it your own personal mission.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I let my feelings —

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Oh, don't you dare apologize. Like it could absolve you of what you've done to me, my family. He was fine.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I understand why you're angry. But this isn't where you belong right now.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: He won't let us in the room.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: He's a teenager, you're his mother. This is not the time to start listening to him. Go be with him. (Melanie walks back toward Jackson’s room.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I didn't do it for you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We made a mistake.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, we didn't.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The methadone's good for him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The methadone is gonna kill him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: He shaved. He was wearing a tie. He has a meeting at St. Sebastian.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: If he buys a new pair of shoes, should we let him smoke crack?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Cuddy, he's happy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House doesn't do happy, pain or no pain.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Okay, maybe, but, he's our friend. And this is his one chance to not be miserable.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The heels. Very nice.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No reason not to wear them now that House is gone.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah. Just tired.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Got some good news. Patient's scleroderma is responding to the anti-inflammatory meds. His AST level's dropped a bit.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So he's dying slightly less quickly than we thought. That's great news. I'm not okay.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Next time just say that.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What's his AST?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Uh... 185, I think.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That's a pretty fast drop. Are we sure it's from the anti-inflammatories?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What else could it be from? He's been off the antibiotics for a while. Proton pump inhibitor's wouldn’t —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He's back on testosterone.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Testosterone wouldn't help his liver function.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: But it could improve his kidney function, which would also lower his AST.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But not in kidneys damaged by scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Which means it's not scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have an interview, in two hours.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hand over my letter of recommendation.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Sorry, I haven't done it yet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have no right to sabotage —

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I was busy with this. It's a list of requirements for your methadone treatment. Weekly drug tests. Supervised doses administered on a precise schedule, by me, or, one of the nurses.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Seems weird, getting my meds here when I'm working somewhere else.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Yes. I'm offering you your job back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I want a raise.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And a bigger office... but in the same spot.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. We both know this is where you belong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Welcome back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're welcome.

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I have issues with authority. You?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We thought you were gone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cuddy missed me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And what happened to your cane?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She asked to borrow it for some reason. Patient dead or do I need to do anything?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's got scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's not scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow. Two days, and you've already got two separate theories.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're back. Good. We noticed a drop in AST levels. It's not from the anti-inflammatory meds.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's because his kidneys got better from the testosterone.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Which rules out scleroderma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When did you two come up with this?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We ran into each other in the lobby.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So, what did we miss? When I say "we" I mean "you," since I wasn't here.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We've ruled out Zollinger-Ellison.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was a dumb idea.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because it was wrong.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Also toxoplasmosis, dehydration, SLE, various intersex disorders.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, crap. This kid like energy drinks?

utterance.speaker: Kutner
utterance.content: I saw some empty bottles in the team locker room.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But energy drinks don't explain —

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice work.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So, we're okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why wouldn't we be? Nice heels.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is all your parents' fault.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chug a lot of energy drinks before, during, and after practice?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your son came in here with simple dehydration. That's why he collapsed during the game.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: The ER treated him for that. It didn't help the pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's where the energy drinks came in. They put a strain on his kidneys so he needed more time to rebound from the initial dehydration.

utterance.speaker: Joseph
utterance.content: Then why isn't he better?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's where your idiocy came in. Before we could give him another glass of water, you two insisted I do an MRI. So, I go down a blind alley looking for a blind uterus. And my team injects him with contrast material. If his kidneys had been healthy, they would've filtered out the contrast in a couple hours. Since they weren't, it went around and around, eventually getting absorbed by his heart, his liver, and his pancreas; getting in trouble everywhere it went. Your son was fine when he got here. It was your freaked-out overprotectiveness that nearly killed him.

utterance.speaker: Melanie
utterance.content: Nearly?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He's young. A few weeks of dialysis, he should be fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You gave birth to a freak of nature. Doesn't mean it's a good idea to treat him like one.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: How you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: A little bit better.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I saw you talking to your parents earlier. That's good.

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: My mom asked if I wanted to take dance lessons.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That's great!

utterance.speaker: Jackson
utterance.content: I'm actually worried I might miss basketball. Starting to get good.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No reason you can't do both.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Starting tomorrow, you'll come to my office for your fix.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm done with the methadone. I screwed up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The kid’s parents wanted that MRI.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I knew he didn't need it. I did it anyway. That's what got him sick.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You just solved a case that no one else could solve.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I created a case. I played nice because, I was in a good mood because, I didn't hurt.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You don't need your pain to be a good doctor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not interested in good.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're afraid to be happy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why do you care if I'm happy?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're afraid of change. The one thing you have is your intellect. You think if that's compromised, you have nothing. Just take it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Don't do this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's already done. This is the only me you get.
